result.execSummary:
The defendant Karl S Holik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.314(3)(a).
  • Resist Conservation Warden, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.951.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall pay fine, costs, fees, and surcharges at the rate of $50 per month commencing August 1, 2015 or judgment shall enter for nonpayment.    There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

records.descr: Notice to DNR of court ordered revocation

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Case recalled.  On a plea to Ct. 2 & 3, State moves to dismisss and read in Ct. 1.    Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2 & 3; Colloquy w/ Defendant; Court accepts plea, finds defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction, on motion of the State, Court dismisses Ct. 1 for read in.  Joint recommendation.  Court imposes a fine of $1873 and a 3 year DNR license revocation.  Fine shall be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/15 or judgment shall enter for nonpayment.    There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Court passes case.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant has not retained counsel and just recently became unemployed.  (SPD slip provided)  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond.    Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
